Name: Burger Bash
Description:
It's burger time!

Fill orders by stacking your ingredient cards the fastest.  Careful not to make too many mistakes, or your customers won't be pleased...

The player with the highest points earned from their completed orders, wins!

Full rules:


     Each player is given 5 each of 10 ingredient cards. They can arrange the ingredient cards in front of themselves however they choose. 
     The order deck is shuffled and placed face-down in the center of the table. 3. All players take one card from the order deck without looking at the card, and hold the cards above the center of the table face-down. One player takes two cards. The order cards are placed face-up in the center of the table at the same time. 
     Everyone races to make one of the burger orders from their ingredient piles. All players go simultaneously. 
     When a player finishes an order they grab the order card from the center of the table and place it on top of their gathered ingredients. They place the stack in their section of the table and flip over a new ingredient card from the order deck. 
         When building a burger the player should hold the cards for the current burger they are working on in their hands. 
         Ingredients must be in the same order they are on the order card with the top burger ingredient on top and the bottom ingredient on the bottom of the stack. 
         Players can make an order from any of the cards that are flipped over, they do not have to make an order from the card they flip over. 
         If another player completes an order and grabs the order card you were working from, you need to start over with a different order. 
         Players can only build one burger at a time, but they can always modify their current, un finished burger that is in their hand. 
         Once a player picks up an order card for their burger, the player cannot modify that burger anymore. 
         A player can grab any face-up order card whether or not their burger fulfills the order. If it doesn’t fulfill the order exactly, the player may lose points. 
    
     Players continue to make orders until one player runs completely out of one of their ingredients. Once they run out they say DONE and everyone must stop what they are doing immediately. 
     Players now become the customers and move one spot to the left to verify each burger order is correct for that player.

Name: Castles in the Sky
Description:
A Wargame of Flying Battleships

It is the dawn of the 20th Century, and the Great Powers turn to war.  Since the development of the airscrew and the creation of the first flying warships, the navies of the world have grown to be dominated by these aerial ironclads.  So fire up the turbines, ready the aether drives and take to the air in Castles in the Sky: A Wargame of Flying Battleships.

Castles in the Sky is a steampunk miniature wargame using your own models or tokens, set in the early 20th century.  Each model represents an individual warship in one of three classes, either escort, cruiser or battleship.  Engagement are typically made up of small skirmishes between a handful of ships per side.  Rules are provided for using aeroplanes, aerial torpedoes, sky mines as well as bombing of ground targets.  There is also a simplified campaign system presented.

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Scarlet Keys: Investigator Expansion
Description:
The tale of The Scarlet Keys begins in Arkham with a spread of mysterious disappearances. As objects, animals, and people vanish, so too do they disappear from the memory of those left behind. Only you and your fellow investigators remember them—or so you thought. When an enigmatic letter arrives, its author claiming to also remember those who disappeared, it marks the beginning of an epic journey that will take you across the globe and under the scrutinous eye of the mysterious and deadly Red Coterie.

When we say “across the globe,” we mean that literally. The Scarlet Keys Campaign Expansion introduces the game’s very first completely non-linear campaign. After the prologue concludes, you and your party choose where to go next, and wherever you go determines what scenario you play. This means that, with the exception of the prologue and the finale (which always occur first and last, respectively), all of the scenarios in this campaign can be experienced in any order. However, you may not experience all of them in a single playthrough, since one of the greatest threats in the campaign isn’t the Mythos: it’s time.

The Scarlet Keys is the newest campaign expansion to Arkham Horror: The Card Game. Just like with Edge of the Earth, you will find only player cards in the Investigator Expansion and only scenario cards within the Campaign Expansion. Whether you want one expansion or both, the world of Arkham Horror just got bigger!

The Scarlet Keys Investigator Expansion brings a massive spread of new player cards to the game, including six new investigators!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Scarlet Keys: Campaign Expansion
Description:
The tale of The Scarlet Keys begins in Arkham with a spread of mysterious disappearances. As objects, animals, and people vanish, so too do they disappear from the memory of those left behind. Only you and your fellow investigators remember them—or so you thought. When an enigmatic letter arrives, its author claiming to also remember those who disappeared, it marks the beginning of an epic journey that will take you across the globe and under the scrutinous eye of the mysterious and deadly Red Coterie.

When we say “across the globe,” we mean that literally. The Scarlet Keys Campaign Expansion introduces the game’s very first completely non-linear campaign. After the prologue concludes, you and your party choose where to go next, and wherever you go determines what scenario you play. This means that, with the exception of the prologue and the finale (which always occur first and last, respectively), all of the scenarios in this campaign can be experienced in any order. However, you may not experience all of them in a single playthrough, since one of the greatest threats in the campaign isn’t the Mythos: it’s time.

There has never been a campaign for Arkham Horror: The Card Game of this scale and this scope, and only you and your fellow investigators can travel the globe and unravel the mysteries of The Scarlet Keys before it is too late.

The Scarlet Keys is the newest campaign for Arkham Horror: the Card Game. Just like with Edge of the Earth, you will find only player cards in the Investigator Expansion and only scenario cards within the Campaign Expansion. Whether you want one expansion or both, the world of Arkham Horror just got bigger!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game

Name: めぐるめぐみ (Meguru Megumi)
Description:
In this co-operative game, players play cards to circulate water. They discuss with each other in order to prevent sewage from overflowing or running out of water, and treat the sewage so that it can be returned to nature and used again.

—user summary

Meguru Megumi is a board game where you can enjoy learning about the mechanism of the water cycle and the importance of water resources.
It is used not only for playing at home, but also for elementary school classes and training for companies and local governments.

For those who are playing the game
When you don't get it right, think "Why didn't it work?" and discuss it to make the game more enjoyable and deepen your understanding of the water cycle.

The game has been developed by the Japanese "Carrying Water Project" and 66 ï¼»ãƒ­ã‚¯ãƒ­ã‚¯ï¼½ / "66 RokuRoku Games". It has been published in cooperation with Kansei Kogyo Co., Ltd. and the Japanese "Pipeline Management Research Institute".

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Ardennes 1944-45
Description:
Ardennes 1944

System: Great Battles 1939-45 (WB-95)

Complexity: medium

Scale: Regiment

Boards: 2 × 50/20 cm

Scenarios: 4

Description: The last German major offensive of the western front was a Hitler’s poker move. In desperate attempt to recreate the 1940 success, German armored divisions attacked Americans in Ardennes, fighting their way to cross the river Meuse and to capture Antwerp. But despite the initial successes, Germans failed to capture Bastogne and some other key points. With Allies reinforcements coming every day, German offensive was stopped, even the use of the 150th Armored Brigade, armed with the captured US equipment, couldn’t change it. Game for the players who like risky, daring maneuvers and desperate attacks.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: Wielkie Bitwy 1939-45 (Dragon / Taktyka i Strategia)

Name: Word Trap
Description: A word game whose object is to form words of specified lengths, built around two-letter combinations. The game is a spiral book of sheets; each player has a sheet to fill in, so any number can play simultaneously.

Name: Velonimo: Legends
Description:
6 promo cards to add to the game, offered at conventions and by board game stores.

Rules
5 Legendary Sports Managers
Each player receives a random Legendary Sports Manager Card at the beginning of the game and place it in front of them.
You may use it only if you don't own the Peas-and-Carrots Jersey. When you use your card, flip it face down.
The player with the fewest points may reactivate their Sports Managers Cards at the end of the round.

Broom Wagon
At the end of each round, the player who finished last takes the card and place it face up in front of them.
Once per round, they may play it to add +5 to their attack.
The Broom Wagon cannot be played with a Baroudeur (Hare).

Name: I Need You So Much Closer
Description:
Designed for a game design jam, I Need You So Much Closer (INYSMC) is a roll & write game to be printed at US letter size.

You will drive aimlessly for as long as you can, using dice to determine the shapes of your path that you draw on the map, while listening to Transatlanticism by Death Cab For Cutie, a list of songs and corresponding numbers that you’ll use dice to trigger and use their special abilities.

This game can be played with any number of players, each of whom would need their own sheet. Each player will also need 3 six-sided dice and something to write with.

Name: Richard Osman's House of Games
Description:
Family party game based on the BBC TV game show. Features 10 trivia games from the TV show including the iconic Answer Smash game.

Players play rounds both as individuals and as teams trying to answer various categories of trivia questions.

The player who answers the most questions, wins.

—user summary

Name: Kiribati
Description:
The wonderful island of Kiribati, like many islands in the Pacific, is threatened by climate change.
In the foreseeable future, Kiribati will be washed over by rising sea levels and sink.
People can be evacuated by ships and boats - but what about the animals?
Fortunately, numerous turtles swim from west to east between Kiribati and the rescuing mainland, and Kiribati's animals can save themselves by jumping from turtle to turtle.
But beware. Turtles have their own ideas. They may well swim deeper, or submerge completely. This makes the space on their shells smaller and smaller until it disappears completely.

Kiribati is a small tactical game. The goal is to move all his animals to the mainland. The first to do this wins the game. The game ends immediately.

Each Player try to be the first reaching the mainland with all your 5 animals by using dice and action cards.

Kiribati can be played in three variants (children, family, professional).

Each round the player rolls two dice. The number of dice decides where and whether the player may insert a new turtle or let it swim further, or whether a turtle rises or dives. Next, the player may place one of his animals from the island on a turtle. The player's third action is to move all of his animals one turtle further. Each animal (kagu, rabbit, coala, lizard, monkey) has its own properties for movement.
Additionally, the player may play an action card and annoy teammates or defend himself to other teammates.

In the professional variant, events can occur at the beginning of each round. The professional variant is played with victory points.

Name: Night Express
Description:
Starting on a blank European railway network you and your fellow players are aiming for the best routes, getting the best available trains, improving routes and trains, increasing the number of passengers and overcome a phase of events. You can get help from specialists in several phases of the game. Secret route targets and special bonuses can make you the winner. But you also have to keep an eye on your fellow players as they can compete with you on your routes and therefore reduce your scorer points. They even can place negative events on you. But you can do so as well!

The game is played in 4 rounds. You always start by choosing a route board from a given selection of available routes. You will prefer to get routes with many passengers, short travel time, good connection to your existing routes and whether they support  your secret route targets chosen at the beginning of the game. You now need to establish a service point for each route in order to operate it. You can save money using one of your existing service points or using one of your competitors.

After 4 round’s validations you can get additional scorer points by fulfilling your route targets, having the biggest train fleet, the best single route or most money. Then you will know who this time is the winner of Night Expresss.

Name: Nitroplus Card Masters: EX
Description:
This game is the 4th expansion to Dominion Nitroplus Card Masters.

It features 305 cards with characters from "Hello, World.", Axanael, Phantom of Inferno, Kikokugai - The Cyber Slayer, Song of Saya, Deus Machina Demonbane, Sumaga Special, Full Metal Daemon Muramasa, Outlaw Django ~ Zoku: Satsuriku no Django, Sonicomi, Vampirdzhija Vjedogonia, Tokyo Necro, Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet, Expelled from Paradise, Full Metal Daemon Muramasa Makai Hen, D.Y.N. Freaks, Chaika - The Coffin Princess, and PSYCHO-PASS.

This expansion also adds New Victory and Coin Cards.

Name: The School Escape
Description:
You and your friends hate your boarding school, but only one can escape. Return all your items so your backpack can fit through the vents and don't get caught by Ms. Crawford or there will be consequences. Explore the school to find shortcuts and rooms to return your items. Sabotage your friends, or now known as enemies. Risk it all or you might just stay in school.

You can either explore, move, return items or escape through the vents. When someone explores the staff room, Ms. Crawford emerges. If she catches you, she will give an item causing you to be 1 step further from victory.

This game was made by a 14 year old with a passion of board games. It took him a total of 5 months to make. He got the idea while eating some mushroom soup. His biggest obstacle making this game was the art and the photoshop since he never used any of them. He hopes that you will love his game and has a goal to make sure every single person on the planet loves board game.

—description from the designer

Name: O Grande Colecionador de Brinquedos
Description:
You are a collector of toys from the 60s to the 90s, specialized in toys sold by Estrela in Brazil.
Each round you will acquire 2 new toys for your collection, one by draft and another by auction.
The auction takes place in several auction houses simultaneously, but each player can only bid once and only in one auction house.
After the bids are revealed, the winners receive their toys and the losers have to choose between the remaining toys.
After a certain amount of rounds, each player's collection is evaluated. Each toy scores points in a different way, enhancing combos between them.
The player with the most valuable collection is the winner.

Name: City of the Great Machine: The Escalation
Description:
The struggle between the Resistance and the Great Machine enters a whole new level. New Heroes with unique abilities join the side of Revolution, while the Great Machine enhances its Servants with powerful implants and sends its new secretly trained Servant into the field. The governmental Surveillance Zeppelin now cruises over the City, opening up new opportunities for both sides of the conflict.

The Escalation expansion consists of 4 separate Modules suitable both for One-vs-Many and Solo & Cooperative play. You may add any of them to your games in various combinations. Each Module combines perfectly with each other and the core game. Also, the expansion offers a challenging Aeterna scenario designed for Solo & Cooperative play.

Name: City of the Great Machine: Stand-In Heroes
Description:
The valiant Heroes, represented in the core game, have done their best to resist the Great Machine... but alas have failed. The Stand-In Heroes continue on what their predecessors were struggling for!

The Stand-In Heroes expansion adds 6 new Heroes with exceptional abilities and tactics. Each of them takes place of the corresponding Hero from the core game in their last attempt to stop the Great Machine.

Limited printrun.

Name: City of the Great Machine: The Confrontation
Description:
The Confrontation is a Kickstarter Exclusives Pack that contains the Oracle Zeppelin and the On the Verge Modules as well as unique City Events and a secret Great Machine Enhancement in a sealed envelope.

The Oracle Zeppelin Module may be played both in the One-vs-Many and Solo & Cooperative Modes.

Name: City of the Great Machine: The Escalation Kickstarter Exclusives
Description:
This pack contains exclusive components for the Bring About a Revolution and the Servants of the Great Machine Modules of The Escalation expansion.

With the exception of the alternative Servant cards (OvM), all components may be used in both One-vs-Many and Solo & Cooperative Modes.

Name: Rugby World
Description:
Play a rugby union match with real stats (attack and defence rating at home and away).

The game system is the same that the well known The Beautiful Game which is also done by mr terry goodchild. Stats of the 2 teams give the number of scoring opportunity (chance or half-chance cards). Many expansions exist and it is easy to create new expansions

Name: 99 Rules
Description:
The king has once again proclaimed the mastery of the king's guard. Adventurers flock from across the country to take part in the championship. Not only does the winner of the Championship earn glory and honor by serving in the King's Guard, he can change the rules of the Championship forever.
Only masters in the melee, ranged-attack, and magic classes have a chance to be victorious.
Will you triumph?

First Rules are:
Play a card
Draw a card

But after each stage, new rules and actions are added that make the game more exciting.
Sometimes the rules are only in play for a short time and are then replaced by another rule.
Action guaranteed!
The best thing is: You determine the rules and actions that come into play.
In the Book of Winners there are far more than 100 rules and actions. But less than half of them find their way into the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Cult of Dionysus
Description:
Cult of Dionysus is a truth or dare style party game of strategy, skill, and chance, in the form of a classical sculpture called a herm (a 4-sided column with a bust on top). The column is made of 72 6-inch wooden blocks, each featuring a unique ancient Greek name and corresponding prompt infused with history and mythology. Players take turns pulling blocks, doing what they say, taking penalties, and trying not to topple the bust of Dionysus. After each topple, the herm is rebuilt from the rubble and gameplay continues until no blocks remain. The player with the fewest penalties at the end wins. Each game lasts 1-3 hours.

—description from the designer

Name: THE 仮想通貨 (THE Cryptocurrency)
Description:
Increase your assets by buying and selling while predicting the ups and downs of the values of 6 types of cryptocurrencies!
Will you be a "billionaire" who earns 100 million or a "melter" who goes bankrupt?
You can learn about the concept of cryptocurrency while playing!

Name: I'm Survivor
Description: Players must consume water and food every day to keep their characters alive. To do this, you must collect as many supplies as possible during the day and exchange supplies with other players to ensure that your characters are fully viable. And when relief comes, supplies are needed to raise the priority of rescue.

Name: Pick Eat
Description:
Pick Eat is a card game about food nutrition and balance healthy diet.

Just as in our daily life's diet habit, in game, players take turn to "treat" opponents some food, meanwhile have to decide and choose our preference food type, in the aim of building a healthy and balance diet combination.

Pick Eat is a "I cut you choose" drafting game that themed on nutrition pyramid. In turn, players look at the top three cards, then decide and offer them, one face-up and two face-down, to next opponent. The opponent then decide, whether to take the only one face-up, or to choose one secretly from the two face-down cards.

If opponent chooses the face-up card, active player gets to choose one from the two face-down cards. If opponent decides to get one from the two face-down cards, active player gets the one face-up cards. Card(s) collected through face-up will form "Open Food Menu" and card(s) collected through face-down will form "Hidden Food Menu".

Game goes few rounds depends on player count, and at the final turn, players will get two cards each from the discard piles, then distribute them one each to the left and right opponent, and all players to be adding the two cards received from opponents into the Food Menu, finally forming the full diet. Scoring then occurs and player with the highest score wins.

Are you ready to learn to be more responsible for own diet?

“We PICK what we EAT”

—description from the publisher

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Aya Lantern Armor Promo Cards
Description:
Beta Rules - 1 x Glossary Card, 2 x Gear Card, 1 Specialization Card that were included with the Aya - Lantern Armor First Run Collector's Edition that was not part of the based game.

1 Glossary Cards for new living glossary: Lantern Armor Proficiency.
New Gear: Soldier Lantern Cuirass and Refined Lantern Axe.
New Specialization: Lantern Armor Proficiency.

The First Run Collector's Edition is enclosed in a hand-stamped kraft box, limited to 500 and includes:

Photoresin Aya - Lantern Armor
1 x Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round insert and base
Large Matte Art Print
Character Art Card
Beta Rules - 2 x Glossary Card, 1 x Gear Card, 1 Secret Fighting Art Card
First run collector's edition: Signed and numbered authenticity note
Deathgrey edition limited to 250: Deathgrey authenticity note

With her wish fulfilled and one of the 13 Death Crowns in hand, Aya found herself unable to face her destiny and joined a settlement where she secretly buried the cursed relic. Lantern years faded into the darkness as Aya became a champion among her peers, the Crown calling her back to defend the rocky prison she had made for it.

Name: Ducks in Tow: The Bugs & Slugs Expansion
Description:
Another sunny day in the Duck Sanctuary! Along with the seeds you have been feeding the ducks, you also want to give them tasty treats. With your brand new bug jar, you're ready to collect some bugs.

The Bugs & Slugs Expansion adds player boards, duck cards and bug tokens. There will be bug tokens on the board that you can collect and feed them to your ducks. The player boards and duck cards have token slots on them. Once the token slots are all filled, they grant you special abilities that can be used on your turn.

Each duck card matches 1 of the 4 coloured rows on your location cards. At the end of the game, completed duck cards will gain you points based on the connected rows of ducks on your completed location cards.

-description from designer

Name: Nitroplus Card Masters: Edge
Description:
This game is the 3rd expansion to Dominion Nitroplus Card Masters.

It features 190 cards with characters from "Hello, World.", Axanael, Phantom of Inferno, Kishin Hishou Demonbane, Guilty Crown: Lost Christmas, Kikokugai: The Cyber Slayer, Vampirdzhija Vjedogonia, Gekkou no Carnevale, Deus Machina Demonbane, Hanachirasu, Jingai Makyou, Full Metal Daemon Muramasa, Kimi to Kanojo to Kanojo no Koi, Phenomeno, PSYCHO-PASS, and Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet.

Name: Hostage Negotiator: Career – Alternate Finale Pack #1
Description: The first Alternate Finale Pack, providing a completely different finale to your Career experience. Adds 14 new cards to your Career game.

Name: Black Coin
Description:
Black Coin is a an auction game about collecting the most assets.  Each round players participate in two sets of auctions.

In the first auction, a set of cards is revealed face up.  In turn order, players point at the cards they want, and in reverse turn order, they either withdraw from the auction, or bid with face down coins.

Any players that withdrew from the card auction then participate in a second auction for the coins that other players bid in the first auction of the round.

There is a special coin token which allows a player to automatically win any auction they are involved in.  However, if when refilling the card market a police card is revealed, they conduct an inspection and any player caught holding the black coin must discard a certain number of card they had won.

The game ends when a certain number of police cards have been revealed, and the person with the most points wins.

Name: Forgotten Willows
Description:
The Realms of the Willows has been at peace since the Great War. That is until now... The evil wizard Alzod has returned to claim the Realms by casting a spell of Shadow Dragons upon all the lands. Alzod has trapped all of the Realm Leaders and the beauty of the Willows has been forgotten. Only the Fairies of the Willows have the power to see beyond his Dark Magic. Together the Fairies must find and use the magical power of Realm Artifacts to free the Leaders and defeat the wizard.

Forgotten Willows is an action selection game for 2-4 players ages 12+ to save the Realms of the Willows. As well as a battle among the Fairies to be the best. On your turn you may perform 2 of 4 actions. At the end of the game, you will receive points for Freed Leaders, Collected Dark Magic, and Defeated Shadow Dragons. The Fairy with highest total is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Werewolf in the Dark
Description:
The unforgettable game that combines the classical game of Werewolf with hide-and-go-seek, Werewolf in the Dark!

The social deduction of Werewolf
Who among the villagers is the Werewolf?
During the daylight phase, vote to eliminate a player you suspect of killing others at night.

The childhood intensity of Hide-and-go-Seek
During the night phase, everyone hides in pitch black darkness
Only the Werewolf can double tap you, eliminating you.

A never-ending night only the dead can cure!
Don't get too cozy in your hiding spot, as a Werewolf can win in a single night.
You must venture out and find a body to end the terrifying night phase.

Dozens of roles with unique abilities
Many different monster types
Many different "villager" roles,

No need for a host, everyone plays

Elimination is only the beginning!
Eaten by a monster? Eliminated by vote? No worries.
Everyone comes back as one of many different types of "ghosts" to enhance the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cyberpunk 2077: Gangs of Night City – Side Gig
Description:
The Kickstarter Exclusive Side Gig Expansion adds Fixers and Engrams to your games of Cyberpunk 2077: Gangs of Night City.

Each of the 7 Fixers keeps to their own district. While they're not directly hirable like Edgerunners, players may establish connections with them, gaining their unique ability and perks.

The Engram Module is a plug 'n' play system that adds 2 such Relics into the Opportunity deck of your games. Engrams are powerful objects and work differently from a standard Opportunity when obtaining them.

—description from the publisher

Name: Weather Report
Description:
In this game, God decides the weather on a whim. Let's guess the weather for 5 days by asking God questions that can be answered with "Yes" or "No”.

Weather Report is a deduction/20 questions style game where the goal is to guess what the weather will be for the week. One player plays God and secretly decides 5 days worth of weather, the weather forecasters can ask 10 questions to deduce what the week’s weather will look like. You can play in 4 modes: God vs 1, God vs team, God vs many, and Perfect Weather.

Perfect weather is slightly different, with only 8 questions given but with 7 of the weather tiles that were not used revealed.

Name: Guess & Confess
Description: Even with a big group, you can play within 5 minutes of opening the box. The rules are simple and quick to pick up, while the whiteboards are super fun to use! Players compete for points by guessing how people would answer an eclectic mix of yes or no questions. The dynamic gameplay is fun, yet strategic - everyone participates in every turn and as you learn more about the other players, voting strategies shift and it's an all-out race to the finish line!

Name: Black Powder Epic Battles: The Waterloo Campaign
Description:
Sunday, 18 June 1815; on an unassuming rain-soaked field in Belgium; two great generals of the age finally met in battle. The climactic clash of the Hundred Days campaign wrought the end of around twenty years of continuous warfare on the continent, and with it an end to the reign of Napoleon. The Battle of Waterloo, arguably the most famous battle in all military history, provides more than a fitting subject for our second foray into the 'Epic' scale of wargaming. Black Powder Epic Battles: Waterloo is here.

—description from the publisher

Name: LÆST
Description:
LÆST ("READ") is a game for everybody who loves literature. Mostly about Danish literature from present times and 100 years back, but LÆST also reaches further back and further out in the world. LÆST contains questions about everything from the poets of avant-garde to the biographies of sports idols and treats all books with respect - and lack thereof - for the world of literature is not only intelligent and exciting - it can also be petty, elitist and banal. READ is for young and old, and the really old can join in too!

Everyone gets a piece that starts in the start field, and the one whose first name comes first in the alphabet starts.

You roll the die, which goes from 1-3, and move the number of spaces rolled, then you have to answer a category's question, all depending on which place you landed on.

If you answer correctly, you get to roll  and move again. If you answer incorrectly, the turn goes on to the next player.

If you land on a question field, the other players jointly decide which category to answer before they have read the question on the card. If you answer correctly, you must move an opponent two steps back and get a roll and move again. If you answer incorrectly, you take two steps back.

If you land on a hypnosis field, the journey continues to the next player.

There are four different categories of questions:
Forfatterliv (Authors life), Set og Hørt (Seen and Heard), Rundt om bogen (Around the book), and LÆST (READ where the start of a book is read aloud).

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Silhouetters
Description: Silhouetters is a fast all play word game, where players shout out what they see and what they can imagine! Roll the 3 letter dice and find things that start with those letters hiding in the shadows. The more you spot the more points you win!

Name: The Exorcist
Description: Priests perform sacred rituals to exorcise demons from the possessed. By reasoning and deducing, they must try to figure out a correct sequence of rituals to rid them of evil! If they need to contact the demon for help, the priests will be pulled to the Dark Side. However, if they perform a ritual more than once… the dark is turned back into the sacred.

Name: Jurassic World: Escape the Island
Description:
Isla Nublar is the most feared island in the Jurassic World. This island - a few hundred miles west of Costa Rica - is home to the one and only Jurassic Park, and a few years later the new home of the highly secure Jurassic World. Still, nothing can stop the Indominus Rex from rocking the park again. When it turns out that the volcano on the island threatens to wipe out all the dinosaurs that have erupted again, it's up to a brave team of players to save the dinosaurs from their second extinction. You and all players embark on a perilous journey through Isla Nublar, trying to save as many dinosaurs as possible and reach the helicopter before the volcano floods the island with lava.

In this exciting action card game you have to strategically find the fastest way through the island and reach the helicopter with as many dinosaurs as possible. The player with the most rescued dinosaurs wins the game.

Search for the Safe Zones in each row and make it to the Helicopter with the most Dino Tokens!

Name: Spørgsmål fra Helvede!
Description:
Questions from Hell!

A game about both getting to know each other, by answering more or less personal questions, and about teasing or trolling each other.

The active player (the Angel) select a question from the table, and writes down and read aloud a truthful answer to the question.

Then each other player (the Devils), select a question from their hand. The selected questions are shuffled and the Angel reads out the questions, answering with the previous written answer.

After all questions are read aloud, the Angels select the best/funniest/rudest/worst/etc. question, and the Devil submitting that question gets a point token.

The Angels submits one question to the middle of the table, and all used questions are replaced with new questions from the stack.

The next player clockwise becomes the new Angel, and play continues until one player has 5 point tokens.

—description from the rulebook (translated)

Name: IT: Chapter Two
Description: Explore the sewers, don’t get scared or Pennywise will get you! Explore the sewers together and find the lost items that were left behind the last time you were here… Pass too many Pennywise Balloons and you’re going to get a big jump scare!

Name: Friday the 13th
Description: A razor-sharp, cooperative and edge-of-your-seat game where speed can save your life. Move fast to escape Jason’s machete! Players must complete survival missions against time to try and survive the week. But with Jason hunting them down, BLOOD WILL FLOW. Because failing survival missions gets campers killed. So you better think fast, or you’ll all end up with a machete in your head. Ouch!

Name: Batman Henchmen
Description: Joker is recruiting Henchmen to help him pull off a series of money heists across Gotham and you’ve been selected! Play as a team to complete the crimes, but if you play smart you’ll end up with the best loot and send the other Henchmen looking for a new job! First Henchman to reach $1M wins.

Name: Myn Pikkewyn
Description:
Myn Pikkewyn (Afrikaans for: "Mine Penguin") is a family-friendly fun board game where fish-hungry penguins help you to mine precious metal nuggets from a floating iceberg. These nuggets are used to fulfill contract cards, earning players victory points. The player with the most victory points at the end of the game wins.

The game consist out of a game board in the form of a giant floating iceberg. On the iceberg is 30 faced down nuggets to be mined. Each player have 4 plastic penguins as the maximum number of workers per round. Other components are action cards, contract cards, precious metal nuggets and resources.

At the start of every round, players take turns to place their available workers (penguins) to either harvest resources or mine nuggets on the iceberg through worker-placement. Once enough penguins(as indicated per mining tile) are placed on a mining tile in the iceberg, the precious metal may be mined. At the end of each round, players recall all the penguins, who bring their mined nuggets and resources back with them. Resources may be used to purchase action- or contract cards. The action cards may be played in the next round to upgrade mining skills or to increase the players penguin colony by adding additional (to a maximum of 4) penguins. The nuggets of precious metals and contract cards are kept until the end of the game.

Once all the tiles on the iceberg is mined, the game ends and the players apply their nuggets of precious metals to their contract cards, earning victory points for each completed contract. The player with the most victory points win the game and is declared the Myn Pikkewyn.

Name: Quella Notte nel Bosco
Description:
Chiariamo subito una cosa: questo gioco non sarà divertente! Vi troverete al buio (sì, avete capito bene, proprio al buio!), nel bel mezzo di un bosco fittissimo, dove si aggira qualcosa di mostruoso! Io non vorrei essere nei vostri panni!

Let's get one thing straight out of the way: this game isn't going to be fun! You will find yourself in the dark (yes, you got it right, right in the dark!), in the middle of a dense forest, where something monstrous is wandering around! I don't want to be in your shoes!

Name: Pluzzables: Muskoka
Description:
Pluzzables are “playable puzzles” - a collection of puzzles you play as games after assembly. Additionally, several web apps come with the game for simpler "match and claim" or discovery games.

The Muskoka edition is a puzzle of the 1949 vintage Imperial Oil Road Map of Muskoka, Ontario (Canada's famous cottage country). After assembly, the puzzle becomes a board game where players use web apps to play "What's Missing Muskoka" and "Claim to Fame".

"What's Missing Muskoka" is a competitive game that tests players visual skills in finding locations on the map that match the image displayed and determining what is missing from the image. One image and six possible answers are displayed. Pick the right answer garners one point. Pick the wrong answer and they lose three points.

In "Claim to Fame", players work fast to claim territory. The first player to claim three or four adjacent locations is the winner.

These are games of speed and skill.

As a bonus, kids learn about Muskoka.

—description from the designer

Name: Citywide Delivery: Muskoka
Description:
Citywide Delivery: Muskoka is one of a series of city- and region-centric delivery-type games.

Today is curbside pickup day and your fellow neighbours are eager to share unwanted items. As a local resident, you get to pick up random secret gifts and deliver them to secret locations around your town while delaying your neighbour’s deliveries. Watch out for “porch pirates” and opponents trying to thwart your progress.

The pizza add-on optionally lets players deliver pizzas to secret locations, but first having to locally source the ingredients.

After placing secret items across Muskoka, players get pickup and delivery cards. They use trucks to collect items and deliver them to gain points. The winner will have delivered the most items at the end of a predetermined time period like one hour.

—description from the designer

Name: Lakota Language Game: Elk in the House
Description:
Stop the animals from entering your house and get the animals in your opponent’s house! Open other players' house doors, play rooms and matching animals on your opponents' homes, play closed doors on your own rooms, and use traps to remove animals from your house. The last round begins when the last card is drawn. Whoever has the least animals in their house wins!

Learn: Rooms of the house, animal names, basic conversation phrases, immersive group conversation.

Name: Roundabouts
Description:
Roundabouts is a 2-4 player tile-laying card game. Players take turns drawing and placing square cards to create a grid of winding and charming roundabouts.

While most cards are quarters of circles with a few arrows here and there, some cards have some extra text on them that increases (or decreases) their scoring power.

The goal of the game is to score the most points out of everyone else when the game ends. Points are gained by finishing a roundabout.

—description from the designer

Name: ResiDuel Card Game
Description:
Residuel is a 30 minute 1v1 card duel game with a unique mechanic that places importance on adaptive strategies rather than pre-planned ones. Cards are played for effects that complement each other, however each card you play provides your opponent with materials from which they can create Servants that will punish you until you are able to destroy them.

You must consider whether you'll be able to deal with the creatures your opponent might create using the resources you played cards provide them with.

The player best able to set-up and knock-down the constructs of their enemy will assume the role of create, their enemy fading into history as but another trial overcome.

—description from the designer

Name: Bundle Bugs
Description:
Players take turns playing cards into their tableau to match card patterns chosen during game set up. Players must also play cards into their opponents tableau during the game.

Each of the 6 card types, represented by beautiful original oil paintings, has a unique ability.

Play your cards carefully to keep your scoring opportunities plentiful but try to avoid helping your opponent!

Comes in a small box and is quick to set up, play, and pack up.

—description from the designer

Name: Jamaica: Event Cards
Description:
Add these 6 new card to get more fun in the treasures deck.
When a player take reavele it, all players must apply the effect.

Released by the publisher at Paris Ludique Convention in July 2022.

Name: Sanrio Characters Speedwolf
Description: Speedwolf is a fast-paced party card game that gets everyone excited quickly. Hello Kitty, My Melody, Cinnamoroll, and Pochacco are all appearing and disappearing in this game. Look for the cards that have increased, or decreased, in number, and call out the characters’ names before anyone else!

Name: Explosion in the Laboratory
Description:
Explosion in the Laboratory is a push-your-luck 27 card game where you mix chemicals to create valuable compounds and try not to cause a major explosion!

In Explosion in the Laboratory, you are all chemists mixing compounds in an experimental laboratory. Caution! Being careless could cause disaster. A fire would be unfortunate, as there is a library not too far away...

This is a 27 card game set in the Fire in the Library universe that has the same press your luck and strategy from the base game, but in a small portable science-y version!

During the game players will take turns trying to score points by following a set order of phases: Planning, Mixing Compounds, Scoring Beakers, and triggering Unstable Mixtures.

The planning phase allows players to play 1 time use special ability cards (process cards) that can effect scoring for your turn. Mixing compounds has players laying out chemical cards from the deck to find out what chemicals they must mix based on the fire level in the laboratory (the higher the fire level grows the more volatile the mixtures become). The chemicals mixed can be placed in your available flasks for the turn and the process is repeated until you decide to stop to score or an explosion is triggered by an unstable mixture with certain combos of chemicals in your flasks. The more chemicals you can safely mix the more points you are able to score, but your luck may run short when the wrong chemicals get mixed causing an explosion (and ending your turn without scoring).

Beaker cards sitting in the middle of the table act as a game timer and indicate the fire level and scoring potential of mixtures. As players score beakers and at the end of each round beaker cards rotate changing the point values of the chemicals you've mixed while also moving it closer to the end of the game as once a beaker reaches it's boiling point it will bring an explosive and abrupt end to the game. Whichever player earned the most points throughout the game wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Battle of the Hydaspes
Description:
An expansion for Avalon Hill's Alexander the Great published in the company's in-house magazine "General" volume 12 issue 4 in 1975.

Included a cardstock counter sheet and a 3-page article on the battle with setup/victory conditions for "The Battle of the Hydaspes"

Name: Basho
Description:
A love letter to the fascinating sport of Sumo, Basho is a push and throw trick-taking card game for two players.  It mixes traditional trick-taking gameplay with modern card powers and position control.

You and your opponent collide with the simultaneous reveal of a single card to determine who takes the lead.  From that point on, each trick's winner pushes the token closer to its loser.  Use power cards to change the trump suit or dodge the trick completely to dominate within the arena.

There are three ways to win the round: keep the token in your opponent's area for 1 point, push the token out for two points, or win by throw for 3 points.  Go for the throw with caution! Failing the throw means a big loss in positional control.

Multiple rounds are played, and the first person to earn 5 points or more wins the game.

-description from designer

Name: The Goodge Rules
Description: Trick taking game with a twist. Players bid points to start. Highest bidder controls the stash and names the trump suit. However if the highest bidder doesn't get the points they bid, those points get deducted from their score.

Name: Manöver Spiel
Description:
Each player has 15 soldiers, 4 tanks, 2 planes and 1 commander. The commander is placed into the capital city (marked with a flag). The other units are placed anywhere within the first 4 rows in front of each player. The different units move and capture in different ways. Spaces marked with a square may not be entered and spaces marked with a "x" are obstacles. Units standing on obstacles may not capture other units.

The goal of the game is to take the capital of the opposite player or to capture all his units.

There are simplified rules for younger children.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Elven Throne
Description:
Elven Throne emulates the art of political maneuvering and strategic thinking within a fantasy realm. It combines novel social-networking like mechanics with alliances and counter action chains. Houses can influence and use the help of civilians and beasts, get to control organizations and much more. Up to seven Houses, each with unique characters and abilities, forge alliances and fight to gain influence over the realm.

Organizations, tile maps with hexagonal spaces, link together to form a large play surface. Players move their characters into organizations, activate tiles, and counterattack their rivals in their quest for the Elven Throne. With over 50 characters, variable setup options, and multiple win conditions, each playthrough is a unique experience.

With over 50 characters, variable setup options, and multiple win conditions, each playthrough promises a unique experience.

—description from the publisher

Name: Skeletons
Description:
"A tame
little game
about the contents
of our closets."

Skeletons is a social party game that gradually coaxes some non-invasive secrets out of the players, and ultimately reveals that we all possess a membership card in the brotherhood and sisterhood of similar embarrassments.

You'll combine cards to form a sentence in order to investigate your friends, then collect points for each “skeleton” you find in the collective closet.


     Separate the green deck and the red deck (they have the same colored back) and place them face-down. All players draw 4 cards from each deck.
     The player who owns the game goes first. On your turn, choose a green card and a red card from your hand, so the words at the bottom form a sentence (the skeleton). Read the skeleton aloud.
     All players (including you!) discard one of their cards face-down in the center of the table, forming a loose pile – the closet. They place a green card (“Shhh”) if the skeleton is true for them. Place a red card (“Nope”) if it is not true for them. Be honest in your choice; the answers are anonymous. After placing a card, draw back up to 8.
     When all players have put a card into the closet pile, loosely shuffle it face-down. Dramatically re-read your skeleton sentence and then one-by-one reveal the cards from the closet, saying “Shhh” or “Nope” as appropriate. Only the color of the cards in the closet matters for scoring, not the text at the bottom.
     You score a point for each green card in the closet pile and place them in front of you as spoils. (If ALL the cards in the closet are green, you get NO points and they are placed face-down at the bottom of the green deck.) The red cards in the pile are placed face-down underneath the red deck; each of those fails to give you points.
     Turns proceed clockwise and the game ends when players have no more secrets left to reveal. The players with the most scored points are the best at snooping out skeletons, and should be regarded with caution.


—description from the publisher

Name: Szilaj: A titkos küldetés – Butch LePray
Description:
This is a promo card for the base game, published in issue 100 of JEM ("Magazine of Players").
At the end of the game you get 1 point/horse cards in the inventory of other players.

Name: Card Maze
Description:
In Card Maze, you use a standard card deck to set up a randomly generated maze.

Moving around the maze you gradually strengthen your personal deck by attacking point cards.

Once your deck is powerful enough you can battle the formidable facecards in the maze.

—description from the designer

Name: Life as an Ant
Description:
Life as an Ant is a competitive strategic game in which players compete to establish their colony of ants as the dominant local ant force.

The game consist out of modular boards that can be placed in a number of different ways at the start of the game to create a unique game board for each time you play. Each player has a nest or home base, and a number of starting ants. Resources are evenly distributed over the board. There is also 3 decks of colony cards, each consisting of various different types of ants. Lastly there are a set number of larva tokens set on the game board (dependent on the number of players in the game). The goal of the game is to be the first colony in bringing back 4 larva back to the colony and guaranteeing dominance of your colony over all the ants.

Each round, players take turn to take up to 5 resources from the board, these resources can be used to purchase colony cards from on of three decks. These cards represent one of 6 different ant types and is kept in the players hand. Once per round a player may play a card in their hand and place a matching ant type hexagon tile on the board in a continuous path from their nest towards any of the larva tokens. The player who completes a unbroken path towards a larva first, may carry the larva token back to its nest and continue their path towards the next larva. While players with long routes can easily cut off other players from larva and control a large playing area, there are mechanisms that keep all players in the game until close to the end. Players may attack each other with warrior ants and even play a highly valuable flying ant and steal a larva right under the nose of another.

Once a player returns their 4th larva back to the nest, the game ends and the player wins, becoming the queen ant to rule them all!

Name: Wutaki: Expansion Pack
Description:
Contains 3 Expansion modules for Wutaki.

Flagposts: Achieve bonus points through majority bonus.
Rooms: New powerful upgrades for your Towers of Power.
Specialties: Unique skills for your special workers.

Name: Koomi
Description:
Koomi is a fun learning game to teach children basic math skills by trying to reach the number -10  or 10 using addition, subtraction or special cards.

On a players turn, they must play cards on top of the last played card and reach +10 or -10, or draw one card from the top of the stack. The player may play at most one of the special cards. Special cards can change the start number, change the sign of the card from + to - or reverse, let a player get rid of a card, or make all players move one space in a clockwise direction.

First player to get rid of all cards wins the game.

Name: Codenames: Singapore Edition
Description:
Singapore Edition of Codenames, using Singlish words in addition to standard English words. It contains 200 double-sided cards. About 60 of them contain words that non-Singaporeans will probably not understand, like Kelong, Angmoh and Samsui. It also contains about 40 words that are standard English words, but that have a special or different meaning, connotation or significance in Singapore, like Orchard, Causeway or Hawker. All the local cards have non-local reverse sides, so if you select cards randomly and a local card comes up that somebody is not familiar with it, you can easily solve the problem by turning the card. There are no overlaps with regular Codenames cards, so it can be used as a standalone expansion.

Two rival spymasters know the secret identities of 25 agents. Their teammates only know the agent’s Codenames. The team that contacts all their field agents first, wins.

Name: Dungeon Degenerates: Eyeball Kid
Description:
Single Highland Monster Card that came with Die Wurst Zine #4.

Name: Eyeball Kid
Class: Weird / Filth
Val: 1xp / 1 gold
Target: Lowest PER
Attack: 4
Armor: 2
HP: 4
Abilities: Thief

Name: The R.I.P. Off
Description: The R.I.P. Off is a board game where 3-8 players try to survive a generic Slasher Movie. Choose from over 15 cliché Main Characters and try to level up your stats before the qually cliché Killer arrives and...well... tries to kill all of you. Whether you choose to fight back or escape in car, you'll need to search the cabin in the woods in order to make it to the end of the film.

Name: Team Halloween
Description:
A round based, dedicated deck card game based on Halloween night, where 3 random Halloween Monsters have appeared at the mansion at the end of your cul-de-sac and it is up to you to defeat them!

To do so you will recruit Trick-or-Treaters as they come down your street! Once on your Team you will assign them to an infantry dedicated to a specific monster.

In order to pick first you must win the Pumpkin Picking Contest by picking the lowest numbered pumpkin! However, pick the rotten one and you can't pick a Trick-or-treater!

On your turn you can assign weapons and friends to your Teams, pick on your opponents or save your turn and defend yourself against your opponents!

First to prepare the 3 Teams with enough Hits to beat each Monster wins! Play against your opponents or Team up in pairs and save Halloween night!

-description from publisher

Name: Ogre Sandwich
Description:
Take the perfect ingredients and make the tallest sandwich.  Gain points for sets of Toppings, Critters, and the tallest sandwich. The Chef with the most points wins. Careful: you will lose points for ingredients that fall off the sandwich.

You are an Ogre Chef, and you must compete against other  Ogre Chefs to impress the Ogre King with your culinary  skill. Gather ingredients and Stack them on your sandwich  to create the most delectable meal in the swamp. At the  end, carefully present your sandwich to the Ogre King. The  Ogre King demands a perfect sandwich and he’ll only eat the most delectable offering…May the best Ogre Chef Win.

What Players Do: Roll two dice, the first dice is a mandatory action that involves taking an ingredient of the indicated type from the supply and putting it on your sandwich. The second dice roll is an optional bonus action that will let you grab additional ingredients, place additional ingredients, steal ingredients or force another chef to remove an ingredient from their sandwich.

Game Mechanics: The placement of the ingredients has a few rules. Chefs may only use two fingers when placing an ingredient on their sandwich. Critters must be placed standing up. Lettuce and Cheese must be placed over the top of the critters on your sandwich when you place it. Once you have placed a cheese or lettuce, you must place all future critters on top of the top layer of your sandwich, no tucking critters underneath.

If a critter falls over, you may pick it up one time and attempt to place it again. If you knock anything else over or off of your sandwich during this second attempt, follow the rules for a knocked over or knocked off ingredient.

If a critter is knocked over but remains on the sandwich, it does not count towards your set of critters at the end, but it is still worth 1 point.

If a critter or ingredient is knocked off the sandwich, meaning it touches the table in any way, remove it and any ingredients on top of it from your sandwich. Those ingredients are removed from the game.

The game comes with two modes: Standard Play: Ages 8+ and Basic Play: 5+.

-description from publisher's website

Name: The Missed Flight
Description:
Lucy Kingston has been on a conference tour of Europe, but after speaking some uncomfortable truths to a journalist, she’s found herself caught up in a story of lies and corruption. She’s in way over her head.

She was supposed to deliver your message, but has had to cut her trip short and go into hiding. She was scared the message would be intercepted and so has stashed it in our online vault and put 7 puzzles together from items she’s picked up along the way.

Includes: 10 puzzle pieces + introduction letter

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Theros Beyond Death
Description:
This Magic: The Gathering expansion returns to the world of Theros to continue the story of Elspeth Tirel. When we last saw Elspeth, she had been struck down with her own weapon by Heliod, God of the Sun. Now, we rejoin her in the Underworld as she plots an escape back to the world of the living, covertly aided by Erebos, God of the Dead, who has long held a grudge against Heliod and is now weakening the barrier between life and death just to spite him. Of course, Elspeth isn't the only one to take advantage—other denizens of the Underworld are seizing the opportunity to plan escapes of their own. As the Titans' chains weaken, their guardian, Klothys, God of Fate, returns from her exile and is very miffed at all the trouble that's been stirred up while she was away. Meanwhile, the nightmare mage Ashiok has dark designs of their own...

Theros Beyond Death features the return of the Devotion mechanic from Theros and the Constellation mechanic from Journey into Nyx, and introduces a new mechanic, Escape, that allows spells to be cast from the graveyard. The set contains 254 cards (5 basic lands, 101 commons, 80 uncommons, 53 rares, and 15 mythic rares), and is sold in draft boosters, collector boosters, theme boosters, and bundles. Two preconstructed planeswalker decks, an Elspeth deck and an Ashiok deck, were released alongside the main set as well.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Mystery Booster
Description:
Mystery Booster is a special Magic: The Gathering set designed as a "Chaos Draft" experience, where cards from all across the history of Magic can show up at random. The set contains nearly 2,000 different cards, making it the largest expansion to date.

In its first print run, Mystery Booster was exclusive to conventions, and featured 121 weird, wacky "playtest cards" that were usable only in draft and sealed formats. The following year, the set was made available in retail, with the playtest cards replaced with 121 foil reprints. The year after that, a new printing of the Convention Edition was distributed to affiliated local game stores to celebrate the return of in-store play after the lifting of pandemic restrictions.

Unlike most Magic expansions, Mystery Booster was only printed in English. It was sold in draft boosters in displays of 24 per box.

Name: カメとカエルとエスカルゴ (Turtles, Frogs, and Escargot)
Description:
In ã‚«ãƒ¡ã¨ã‚«ã‚¨ãƒ«ã¨ã‚¨ã‚¹ã‚«ãƒ«ã‚´ (Turtles, Frogs, and Escargot), you are an archaeologist exploring the "Ruins of Escargot". The players earn victory points by finding traces of the Ruins of Escargot, rescuing wild creatures, and completing unexplored terrain.

It is a hex-based tile placement game, where terrain edges must match, but players are also given fence pieces which can be used to allow non-matching edges to be adjacent.

In addition to points being earned for placing animals next to like animals and placing tiles next to at least 3 other tiles, players are given goal cards to choose from which will earn them points.  Some goal cards are public and will score the player points during the game and others are secret and will score at the end of the game.  These goal cards have to do with completing areas of certain terrain types or creating large areas of certain terrains.

The game includes a small expansion which adds tiles featuring a railroad.

The player with the most points wins.

Name: Squirrel Island
Description:
Squirrel Island is a card based game in which you will gather as many nuts as possible over a series of 4 rounds.

When the first nut falls, the game to gather nuts begin. Use your stamina to recruit squirrels and purchase items to help you gather more nuts than your opponents. The winner will be the one who has gathered most nuts at the end of the last day. But you will also add your stashed nuts which might give you a surprise victory!

Squirrels with Loops give you more resources while Unique squirrels have abilities that change the way you play. Find the most efficient nut-producing strategy from the cards in your hand and on the island to win.

—description from the designer

Name: Dorasure Mincas: Another World Trio De Undeads
ドラスレ アナザーワールド ドリームナイツ (Dorasure: Another World Dream Knights)
Dr. 野口っち トリテ (Dr. Noguchi Trite)
Description:
In Dr. é‡Žå£ã£ã¡ ãƒˆãƒªãƒ† (Dr. Noguchi Trite), the players are apprentice virus researchers and while their boss, Dr. Noguchi, is away on holiday, it is up to the three researchers to save the world - through trick-taking!

It is a may-follow, cooperative, trick-taking game for exactly 3 players.  The game uses a deck of 4 suits of cards, with 1 suit for each of the research areas the players will be pursuing, and 1 for the virus.

Each player is assigned a role and will only be able to cure one of the types of viruses.  Each virus has a different mechanism for how it can be researched/weakened, and how it will be cured.

For instance, the red virus is weakened when the player in charge of the red researcher leads a trick with the red 1, 2, or 3, and wins the trick.  Later, if the red researcher can win a trick where they lead the red 4, and the sum of the three cards played to the trick are greater than the virus' strength at the time, then the red virus is cured.

The players win if they can cure the three viruses.  They lose if they have not cured the three viruses at the end of the third hand.

Name: 冒険酒場 カードゲーム (Dorasure: Bouken Sakaba Card Game)
Moonrakers: Binding Ties
Description:
As the UA consolidates power in the surrounding planet clusters, the Moonrakers have finally begun to rise above their petty conflicts and unite under one banner.

In the Binding Ties Expansion, players will gain additional rewards from allying with each other as they gain Faction Reputation with the great houses that each player represents.

Each player has a new Faction Reputation Terminal on which they track their relationship with the various factions, gaining Reputation when they complete a Contract with a great houses’ champion, or losing it if they fail.

The Reputation can mean the difference between completing a Contract or failing, as it can be spent for various rewards like gaining cards or actions, but if carefully saved throughout the game it can even mean gaining additional Prestige.

-description from designer

Name: Moonrakers: Overload
Description:
As the Moonrakers’ influence and population grew, so did the opposition from the Utopian Alliance. Backed into a corner, the Moonrakers entered a new wave of technological advancements. At the center of this innovation was the creation of the IOspheres: a powerful, albeit unstable, energy source that powered a new fleet of ship parts.

Armed with these advancements, the Moonrakers are once again emboldened to explore, defend, and even push back into UA territory.

The Overload adds new Advanced Action Cards, Contract types, and tokens called IOspheres. Overload also doubles the number of Ship Parts and Crew in the game. Players can discover new synergies and advanced mechanics, allowing them to gain more control of their deck composition.

-description from designer

Name: Moonrakers: Nomad
Description:
The Moonraker’s five factions have continued to grow roots throughout the system: establishing defenses, trade networks, and even a loose intergovernmental organization simply called the Council.

The Nomad expansion adds global events, overhauls the Contract system,and adds new prototype Ship Parts to the game.

Each turn a new Event card is revealed. These events can provide challenges, rewards, or even allow players to vote on policies that change the rules.

Each Moonrakers faction operates out of their own sector and offers Contracts that align with its goals. Players travel between these sectors to find Contracts that fit their strengths.

-description from designer

Name: The Fifteen ( ザ・フィフティーン)
平遥 (Heinous)
Description:
The objective of the game is to develop your business and make a fortune by running a financial business in the ancient city of Pingyuan, where the financial industry developed during the Ming and Qing dynasties.

What we are selling this time is its Kickstarter version of Heiyuan, which is in English, but there are no changes in the rules and other aspects of the game.

Make money through asset management and currency transfers!

Players will operate several branches and thereby make money. Silver bars in the branches generate investment income at the end of each round. Silver bars in the head office can also be loaned to generate income.

In addition, players can make foreign exchange transfers between the branches and the head office. This allows you to earn commissions on money orders and to invest your bullion until maturity.

You can also strengthen your branch by staffing it with personnel or paying money to the government office to obtain privileges.

Dice Placement

Each player rolls a die each round and places the rolled die on the action square. The player with the higher die roll gets to act first, while the player with the lower die roll gets more powerful effects.

If a die is placed on a square already occupied by another die, the player pays the difference if the die is smaller than the previous die, and receives the difference if the die is larger. A die cannot be placed on a square with the same number of dice as the one already placed on it.

The essence of finance, right here!

Heiho" is a game that successfully incorporates the essence of the financial business, such as money management and foreign exchange transfer, into a game.

The silver bars and copper coins are made of metal, and the components have also been carefully designed.

Name: Pick It Up
Description:
Essen 2022 preorder link

Pick it Up is a surprising game: The treasure hunt inside your house!

There are no rounds and the players won’t play only around the table.
All players run around the house at the same time trying to find objects that match their cards. 
The cards show 1 or 2 requirements among an icon, a letter, or a color.

When a player ends their deck, the game ends and players score points. In order to be able to score their cards, however, players will have to convince their opponents that the objects they found match the requirements shown on the cards!

-description from designer

Name: Syntopia
Description:
Populate and form a new planet. Create connections between species and ensure balance and diversity. Form joint units of settlers with your opponents, work together and assert yourself as the wisest leader.

Tile-laying, route-building and area control with a twist.

Every player plays a different species. They all came with a giant spaceship to populate the newly discovered planet together. As their common society is very advanced, they know that it will only work out with diversity and balance between the species. And working together. Not through anybody trying to dominate the whole planet. So everyone gets secret missions as a test to choose the wisest leader. Like populating and different areas and connecting them with routes. Or connecting cities. This is achieved by laying tiles. Besides using their leader to shape the land, players can also build units of settlers with the other players. Whenever a player has completed three secret missions, the game ends. The player with the most points wins.

—description from designer

Name: Mystery House: Adventures in a Box – The Secret of Pharaoh
Description:
Essen 2022 preorder link

You raise your head in front of the pyramid’s magnificence. You’ve been called to solve the secret buried inside the glorious building. Are you ready to prove your capacity?

In The Secret of Pharaoh the Mystery House is enriched with a new 3D structure, an Egyptian Pyramid that stands right in its center.

In this new adventure for the game Mystery House: Adventures in a Box you will have to enter the Pyramid and reveal mysteries and secrets of the ancient Egyptians remained hidden for millennia.

-description from designer

Name: Barrage: The Nile Affair Expansion
Description:
The Nile Affair is a new thematic map for 2-4 players with new mechanics (Irrigation).

The box includes 1 map board, 2 punchboards and the rules.

—description from publisher

Name: Lorenzo il Magnifico: New Leaders #3
Description:
This small promo expansion adds 2 new Leaders (Vitellozzo Vitelli & Beato Angelico) to play with the base game.

The New Edition of Lorenzo il Magnifico already include many promos, but not this one.

-description from publisher

Name: Lorenzo il Magnifico: New Excommunications
Description:
This small promo expansion adds 3 new Excommunications tiles to play with the base game.

The New Edition of Lorenzo il Magnifico already include many promos, but not this one.

-description from publisher

Rules :

I - From this moment onwards, each time you play a Leader card, you must pay an additional cost of 1 Coin, 1 Servant and 1 Military Point.
II - Immediately remove from the game one Leader that you have played.
III - At the end of the game, lose 5 points for each Leader you have played.

Name: Pakal: New Schemes
Description:
New Schemes is a promo that adds 4 new Scheme cards for Pakal in order to provide further variability.

-description from publisher

Name: Malevaje
Description:
Malevaje is a game for 1 to 4 players, where brave Malevos from the "hundred neighborhoods of Buenos Aires" face each other for prestige. Simple mechanics of fights through a Duel Deck from which the players will choose the Attack, Team or Action cards to use or discard, making the most of it. Fights full of adrenaline where with a lot of cunning and a little luck you will lead your Malevos to be the most respected and powerful.

During the game, you will confront your fighter against the opponent. Each fighter has strong and weak defense in 3 parts of the body (head, body and lower parts), health (measured in feathers) and a reputation that the player offers in the fight to the player who wins.

The player will also receive 5 "clever" tokens that can be used to avoid some of the cards during the game.

All players play on the same deck that has different attacks, actions and equipment. Then, during his turn, while drawing cards, will decide if to play an attack card, an action card or take equipment.

The game will be defined into rounds (those depend on the number of players) and will the one that wins the most "respect" summing up the rounds.

-description from designer

Name: Good Cop Bad Cop: Zombies
Description:
The Zombies expansion to Good Cop Bad Cop removes player elimination and adds an immediate and growing threat from a third team, the Zombie team.

When a non-Leader would previously be eliminated, they instead join the Zombie team. They win if they can Bite a wounded Agent or Kingpin.

The Honest and Crooked teams still have the same winning condition of eliminating the opposing leader, but they will have to do so while holding back the zombie horde.

The new equipment to this expansion, like Chainsaw, Shotgun, and Machete, are the most deadly we've ever added. Use it carefully or you might end up creating more zombies!

-description from publisher

Name: Witch Hunt 1649: The Dregs of Days
Description:
'We are come to the dregs of days, where it is counted virtue to point out the imperfections of our brethren'. -Zachary Boyd, 1629

Scotland, 1649. The last decade has seen bouts of warfare, outbreaks of plague and seismic political upheaval. The religious authorities are keen to stamp down on sinful behaviour, and witch trials are gathering pace…

In The Dregs of Days, players take on the role of neighbours in an East Lothian village. Players are allied in pairs, so gameplay blends competition and cooperation.* The aim is to develop your holding (home) by buying assets from a shared pool. Let your welfare or reputation drop too low, or get convicted of witchcraft, and it's game over!

Fate cards give players scenarios to navigate, while assets can be used defensively or to attack other players. Optional Story cards offer additional historical context, and each game will feature at least one witch trial, in which accused players try to defend themselves against damning allegations. Gameplay is straightforward while still being moderately strategic. Be prepared for unruly livestock, belligerent neighbours and tales of Satanic orgies, brought to life through colourful quotations from historical records.

Produced by a team at the University of Warwick, Witch Hunt 1649 comprises two fun and educational games. The aim is to provide a sensitive, non-sensationalised exploration of the witch hunts, promoting understanding of the historical backdrop and empathy for victims. The games are available for sale or free download/online play. All proceeds are donated to charity.

Alliances do not feature in 2-player games, and are optional in 3-player games. In games with an odd number of players, one player will be unallied.

—description from the designer

Name: Witch Hunt 1649: Lying Lips
Description:
'woe be to seditious tale-tellers, to lying lips ... It is upon such wicked instruments that the great God hath promised to rain fire and brimstone'. -Simon Grahame, 1609

Scotland, 1649. The last decade has seen bouts of warfare, outbreaks of plague and seismic political upheaval. The religious authorities are keen to stamp down on sinful behaviour, and witch trials are gathering pace…

Lying Lips is an easy-to-learn, fast-paced game with two phases. In the trading phase, players swap assets, aiming to collect particular combinations. Meanwhile, gossip about witchcraft spreads around the village, represented by the dangerous Rumour card. Holding on to this card gives you a chance to control the village's narratives and seize victory, but it's a risky strategy! In the trial phase, players take on roles. Can the trial commissioner and jurors identify the scandal-mongerer?

Lying Lips reflects the importance of words in the witch hunts: accused witches often had a reputation for slandering or cursing others. Optionally, the second phase of the game can be used as a framework for a role-play of a trial.

Witch Hunt 1649 was developed by a team at the University of Warwick. It comprises two fun and educational card games, which can be bought or downloaded/played online for free. All proceeds go to charity.

—description from the designer

Name: The Wonderful World of Güs
Description:
In this boardgame for 4 players, you take a role of a critter - the Güs, whose goal is to collect precise combination of healing crystals and use their power to heal the forest creatures.

You collect crystals from different parts of the magical forest and use the powers of other helpers who trade you crystal, double it, or give you the one you need to complete the recipe. There are also creatures in the forest trying to thwart your effort by blocking the specific part of the forest, stopping for short time, or destroying a crystal in your collection.

The player who heals the most forest creatures wins the game.

Name: UNO Hello Kitty & Friends
Description:
UNO Hello Kitty & Friends card game features cards with beloved Hello Kitty characters and a special rule to enhance gameplay. You want to match a card in your hand with the current card shown on top of the deck, and you’ll score points for the cards your opponents are left holding.

In UNO Hello Kitty & Friends, there’s also a special rule card: the Badtz-Maru card! Badtz-Maru is a mischievous penguin who makes the player with the fewest cards draw four more. And if there’s a tie for the fewest cards, both players draw four cards!
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Adventures in Neverland: The Quest for the Hideout
Description:
A booster (story deck) to change up your game!

This booster features James Hook in "The Quest for the Hideout."

Besides a brand new story, every booster will include new items, special locations, encounters, and tasks!
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Peter Pan
